info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 9 at 5:19PM EDT until July 9 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson KY
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following county, Letcher.
* WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 516 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen with this evening's round of storms. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding, as soils are already wet from the heavy rain that fell earlier this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Whitesburg, Letcher, Blackey, Oscaloosa, Trailer, Premium, Hot Spot, Ice, Kings Creek, Whitco, Day, Roxana, Dongola, Flint, Van, Crown, Marlowe, Jeremiah, Indian Bottom and Bellcraft.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING
